title: Credit & Markets Engineering - Everest SQL Developer
content:
COMPANY OVERVIEW
KKR & Co. Inc., together with its subsidiaries, is a leading global investment firm that offers alternative asset management and capital markets and insurance solutions. KKR aims to generate attractive investment returns by following a patient and disciplined investment approach, employing world-class people, and supporting growth in its portfolio companies and communities. KKR sponsors investment funds that invest in private equity, credit and real assets and has strategic partners that manage hedge funds. KKRâ€™s insurance subsidiaries offer retirement, life and reinsurance products under the management of The Global Atlantic Financial Group. As investors with an industrialist vision, we aim to generate attractive investment returns by following a patient and disciplined approach, employing outstanding people, pursuing the highest standards of excellence, and aligning our interests with those of our investment partners. 
KKR seeks to create value by bringing operational expertise to its portfolio companies and through active oversight and monitoring of its investments. Today, KKRâ€™s portfolio of private equity investments consists of over 120 companies, including businesses such as Epic Games, Go Jek, Hitachi Kokusai, MYOB and First Data. KKRâ€™s approach to private equity investments is simple: the firm seeks to partner with strong management teams to build and grow great businesses over the long run. 
Thatâ€™s theâ€¯technicalâ€¯description of what we do, but on a more personal level, what we really doâ€¯is work tirelessly to help teachers, firefighters, and millions of other hard working people across a whole range of industries turn their hard earned savings into a retirement account they can rely on to retire comfortably.â€¯That is the core of what we do. We use our collective experience across a range of investment categories to help the users we serve retire well. And the global engineering organization is taking on an even more prominent role in that mission.â€¯ 
KKR is investing in wide scale modernization of both our technology stack and the way we approach managing that technology. Our current footprint is a globally distributed technology portfolio deployed both in on-premise datacenters and within public cloud environments around the world.â€¯ 
Underpinning KKRâ€™s success are two cultural characteristics: 1) an emphasis on innovation, creativity and continuous improvement and 2) a focus on operating as a single firm with a single culture with common attitudes and values that emphasize team-work, collaboration, integrity and shared success. 
The Firm has over 1300 employees and KKR Capstone has over 45 executives. There are over 250 private market investment professionals and approximately 120 public market investment professionals. We conduct our business through our offices in 20+ cities, in 16 countries, and on five continents. Our geographic breadth provides us with a pre-eminent global platform for sourcing transactions, raising capital, and carrying out capital markets activities. 
KKR has offices in New York, San Francisco, Menlo Park, Houston, Hong Kong, Tokyo, Beijing, Paris, London, Dublin, Madrid, Frankfurt, Sydney, Singapore, Mumbai, Dubai, Riyadh, Luxembourg City and Seoul.  
POSITION SUMMARY
Everest is the central Trade Order Management system for the KKR credit trading business. The system offers trading, complianceâ€¯and portfolio management functionality by organizing and streamlining daily workflows associated with trading bonds and loans.â€¯ The position is for an Everest application engineer to provide necessary development support to traders, portfolio managers and a spectrum of businesses users that rely on the platform as well as work with various technology teams that integrate with the central trading system.  
The ideal candidate would have a strong familiarity of financial instruments and strong experience in SQL programming.  The candidate must have excellent programming and data management skills, strong verbal/written communication skills, and be a cultural fit with an emphasis on teamwork, excellence and results. 
RESPONSIBLITIES
Support the day to day trading operations of the Everest platform as well as carry out continuous improvements of the platform. 
Work with business users (Traders, PMâ€™s, Operations, Analysts, Finance/Compliance professionals, etc) and perform Requirements analysis, application design and implementation. 
Support the wide range of engineering teams that depend on this platform. 
Ensure a high standard on SLDC with focus on automated testing/regression. 
Align and add to the culture and overall vision/mission of the team. 
QUALIFICATIONS
3+ years or equivalent of working in the financial industry with deep understanding or strong potential to pick up financial securities especially bonds and loans.  
Prior experience with Everest strongly desired but not a hard requirement. 
Strong track record of hands-on Microsoft SQL programming experience. 
Experience with modern development methodologies.  
Strong troubleshooting and analytical skills; detail oriented. 
Knowledge of relational databases, and other data storage solutions. 
Strong cultural fit â€“ Teamwork, proactive/self-starter, results oriented and integrity.
